title: The Woodworker & Woodturner - September 2014 (gnv64)
description:
The Woodworker & Woodturner - September 2014
English | PDF | 92 pages | 15.4 mb

WOODWORKER
14 Study centre
Michael Forster uses all thetricks in his economy textbook to create a flexible and practical work centre for his wife in a living room alcove
21 Who is the fairest?
Gordon Yerr presents an attractive h& rctwood hal l mirror that features space for gloves.
8 clothes brush and a small ornament or two
28 Transport of delight
Duncan Rose has just fitted a kitchen designed to match the age of the customer's home. The final stage of the job was this stunning island on wheels
3S Tick tock 2
last month Paul Betho described making the intricate mechanism for a wooden clock, and mentioned building a case to house it. Here's some more detail about the construction
39 Show and tll
Mark CBSS visits the New Designers' show at London's Business Design Centre and is blown at the huge talent exhibited by this year's students
45 Green for go
Peter Bishop says that there's growing interest in the use of recycled or green materials for making the coffins
49 Pause for thought
Andy Standin,g has recently discovered the calming influence of meditation, and designed this fo$din,g stool to help get him in the mood
53 Veneering 1.: the basic.
Finishing your work wrth decoretive veneers cen add a new dimension. Here we take a look at the basic tools and techniques involved

TURNING
59 In at the Deep End
Colin Simpson explains some of the problems involved in tumin,g deep hollow forms such aS vases, and describes how to overcome them
64 Spindle turning
Chris Child presents the second of a series of articles that will provide a simple int roduction to the tumer's craft. It's spindle turning this time
